safety_precautions: Always wear safety glasses to protect your eyes from dust and debris
Use gloves to protect your hands from sharp objects and chemicals
Ensure the chair is on a stable and flat surface before starting the repair

steps.description: Inspect the chair leg to identify the exact spot where it is loose.
Use the screwdriver to tighten any visible screws that have become loose.
If the leg is still loose, apply wood glue to the joints and fasten the leg to the chair body using the clamp.
Let the glue dry according to the manufacturer's instructions. This usually takes around 24 hours.
After the glue has dried, remove the clamp and check the stability of the leg. If it's still loose, consider using wood screws for additional reinforcement.

tips: Always work in a well-ventilated area when using wood glue
Use the right size of screwdriver to avoid stripping the screw head
If the leg is still loose after using wood glue, it may be necessary to replace the leg entirely
